org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.document.cfg

Interface DocumentStoreProperties

  • All Superinterfaces:
    OgmProperties
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MongoDBProperties

    public interface DocumentStoreProperties
extends OgmProperties
    Common properties for configuring document datastores such as MongoDB or CouchDB via persistence.xml or StandardServiceRegistryBuilder.applySetting(String, Object).

    Note that not all properties are supported by all datastores; refer to the documentation of the specific dialect to find out the supported configuration properties.

    This interface should not be implemented by client code, only its constants are intended to be referenced.

    Author:
    Gunnar Morling

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ASSOCIATIONS_STORE
      Property for configuring the strategy for storing associations.
      static String MAP_STORAGE

      • Fields inherited from interface org.hibernate.ogm.cfg.OgmProperties

        CREATE_DATABASE, DATABASE, DATASTORE_PROVIDER, ENABLED, ERROR_HANDLER, GRID_DIALECT, HOST, NATIVE_CLIENT_RESOURCE, OPTION_CONFIGURATOR, PASSWORD, PORT, USERNAME

    • Field Detail

      • ASSOCIATIONS_STORE

        static final String ASSOCIATIONS_STORE
        Property for configuring the strategy for storing associations. Valid values are the AssociationStorageType enumeration and the String representation of its constants. Defaults to the in-entity storage strategy.

        Note that any value specified via this property will be overridden by values configured via annotations or the programmatic API.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAP_STORAGE

        static final String MAP_STORAGE
        Property for configuring the strategy for storing map-typed associations. Only applies to maps with a single key column which is of type String. Valid values are the MapStorageType enumeration and the String representation of its constants. Defaults to the MapStorageType.BY_KEY strategy. For map associations with more than one key column or a single key column of another type than String always the list strategy will be used regardless of this setting.

        Note that any value specified via this property will be overridden by values configured via annotations or the programmatic API.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
